Key Match Events: Mahmudullah c Patel b Arshdeep Singh 13 (15b 1x4 0x6 30m) SR: 86.66
Pre-Game Insights: Bangladesh will fight to stay alive in the T20 World Cup 2024 when they take on India in their second Super Eight clash in Antigua.
India have relied on Suryakumar Yadav to steer them out of a wobble.
There's growing pressure on Shivam Dube to come good as the spin enforcer.
Bangladesh have an attack with variety, including Mustafizur Rahman and legspinner Rishad Hossain.
Bangladesh's batters haven't given their bowlers enough of a cushion so far in the tournament.
India will come up against Jasprit Bumrah and an in-form Arshdeep Singh.
India are enjoying the flexibility provided by a fully-fit Hardik Pandya.
The rivalry between India and Bangladesh has gained extra edge in recent times.
Miscellaneous Highlights: Rohit Sharma has been dismissed nine times by left-arm quicks in all T20s in 2024.
Shakib is one wicket away from becoming the first player to pick up 50 in T20 World Cups.
Arshdeep Singh is already India's joint-third-highest wicket-taker in the T20 World Cup with 20 wickets at a strike rate of 10.8.
Others: India's team: Rohit Sharma (capt), Virat Kohli, Rishabh Pant (wk), Suryakumar Yadav, Shivam Dube, Hardik Pandya, Ravindra Jadeja, Axar Patel, Kuldeep Yadav, Arshdeep Singh, Jasprit Bumrah.

Bangladesh's team: Tanzid Hasan, Litton Das (wk), Najmul Hossain Shanto (capt), Towhid Hridoy, Shakib Al Hasan, Mahmudullah, Mahedi Hasan, Rishad Hossain, Taskin Ahmed, Tanzim Hasan, Mustafizur Rahman.
